Epic: Celebrate volunteer anniversaries
description:
We want to encourage volunteer recognition by editors. To do that, we should highlight anniversaries of volunteers joining (based on created_at of their User record).

0. Only active Users should be celebrated. That is, Users who have been activated and who are not on a break (or a freeze).

1. When a user interacts with the app within one week (either direction) of their anniversary, show a celebratory message (use Rails I18n, and make the message in Hebrew, and gender-neutral) along the lines of "It's been about %{N} years since you joined us! We greatly value your continuing contribution!"

2. In the admins dashboard (homepage) view, show near the top (under the menu/tab bar) a list of Users who are within one week (either direction) of their anniversary. Alongside each user, mention the number of years they have been registered, and add a button inviting the admin to send a greeting. Clicking the button should pop up a simple modal dialog with a canned message (something like "I've noticed you have been volunteering with us for %{N} years now! That's fantastic!") in a textarea, allowing them (and encouraging them, with a prompt) to edit it as they please and add a personal touch. Once they're happy with the message, they can click a Send button in the modal and the system should send that greeting to the User via email. There should also be a Cancel button to dismiss the dialog.  To help the admin personalize the message, the dialog should also show the volunteer's preferences and the latest 10 Tasks they have been assigned.

3. Once an anniversary email has been sent by an admin to the user, they should no longer appear in the dashboard list. (So add a field congratulated_at to User, filling it when an email is sent, and check against this field before including users in the dashboard anniversaries list).
close_reason: Implemented complete volunteer anniversary celebration feature with all requirements met

title: Create a rake script for validating scans
description:
## Overview

Given a numbered set of images (PNG, JPEG) of Hebrew book pages (one page per file), the goal is to ensure there are no gaps in the scans (that is, that no pages were skipped accidentally), and no duplicates (that no pages appear more than once in the sequence).

## Success Criteria

- [ ] Read each image file in the input directory (specified by rake task argument, or 'tmp/scans/' by default) and extract its page number (may appear at top or bottom, or occasionally not at all)
- [ ] If no page number could be identified, record it as unknown
- [ ] Once all images have been read, attempt to sequence the numbers, tolerating unknown numbers between a known page X and another known page X+Y, assuming there are exactly Y-X unknown pages between them.
- [ ] Output a report (page_validation_output.txt) with a summary (either "Sequence seems complete!" or "There are gaps or duplicates!") and below it a details log of each file name and the page number it contains or is assumed to contain based on its place in a gap between two known numbers.

## Scope

**In Scope:**
- Using any tool for the job, including tesseract if useful.

**Out of Scope:**
- Fixing the sequence
